description: The service here was not good and the pizza is nothing truly special...it got 2 stars from me because when I ate the pizza I was drunk and I liked it....but if I was sober I think it would have been another story.
author: Amiee L.

description:
OMG I FUCKING LURVE THIS PLADCE :-)!!!!!!!!!!!!!  THE PIZZA IS THE BEST IN ALL OF CALI420!!!!  THE BLONDE WAITRESS IS A LITTLE SLO!!!!!!!

also i love the Caesar salad. hail Caesar!
author: zac m.

description: Pricey & greasy.  Friendly service.
author: Kim S.

description: My husband and I came here on a late Friday night while touring SF.  We were craving pizza and this place was close to our hotel. Their specialty pizzas were pretty pricey for what it was but we went ahead and ordered the Fog City Special. The pizza was not OK. It had very small pieces of clam and a handful of shrimp. The crust was nothing special. The only flavor that came out of this pizza was the italian seasoning that they used on the pizza. I probably wouldn't recommend this place.
author: Pugsly W.

description:
2 Stars is generous - 1-1/2 would be about right. We had meatball sandwiches there on the recommendation of the hotel concierge. Food was barely acceptable and the service was marginal. Almost $30 for 2 sandwiches and 2 drinks is way too much for what you get.

Nuff said - too many good places to eat in this town to bother with this one.
author: Alan N.

description: No ice with the iced tea, service was crappy, pizza was crappier.
author: Scott R.

description: Unfortunately we ended up here on our first night in San Francisco. Good news is that it could only get better. The table was sticky and felt dirty. Pizza was undercooked; it might have been fine pizza if the crust wasn't "soggy".  Our order took forever to arrive, then it was partially incorrect so some of us ate and some of us waited for our meal. Had to get up and ask for the check. Looked understaffed. Service was slow and servers were apathetic.
author: Beth S.

description: i visited thisplace on saturday May 18, 2013 and the service was horrible.  It was my wife, my in laws, and my dughter of 13, daughter of 10 and my 10 month old baby. They counted my 10 month old baby as a person and charged me $15 as service charge for a party of 7.  I argued with the asian young lady about this and she did not even care.  I advised her that my son does not eat pizza or pasta at his age and she could care less.  To be honest, this service, thise fraud ruined my evening and trip.  I have been upset about this and i will file a complaint with consumer affairs.
author: Jimmy C.

description: overpriced average pizza i work nearby and decided to try it. $29.00 for a large vegetarian pizza which was very average (soggy). no pizazz. the service was super bad too. she was as slow as a snail to bring the beers. i asked twice and the total wait time was 15 minutes. save your money and go across the street to pizza zone.
author: S. G.

description: Expensive pizza, taste ok at very best. No bathroom, you have to leave the store, walk down the street to use a very dirty restroom.  Look somewhere else for food.
author: Gary L.

description:
Typical pizzeria. The pizza is certainly above average, but not great.

Considering what you get, Fisherman's Pizzeria is a bit higher priced when compared to other pizza restaurants. Nonetheless, the pizza is above average. The hot wings are good as well.

Service is okay. On one visit, we waited about 30 minutes for the pizza to arrive.

Further, on my most recent visit, I was nearly given the wrong type of pizza.
author: A B.

description: After walking around the block looking for a nice place to eat that was playing the Shark's game, I found this little place conveniently right next to my hotel. They were playing the Duck's game (BOOO!!!) and they were in OT, so I asked a patron and they said that they'd play the Sharks after. I ran up to my hotel room to shower and came running back! The game wasn't on so I asked if they could turn it on. Everyone was super friendly and really helpful! Sadly DirectTV was being a butt and the game wouldn't play. But I was really moved with their sympathy! I ordered the Hot Fisherman's Special Sandwich with no tomatoes and onions. My food didn't take long to make and trust me, it didn't take long for me to devour this baby up! I was so stuffed that I couldn't even eat the bag of chips it came with. I wish I knew they vouched for the parking garage next door because I parked across the street! Boo me! It was a great night with great food and a great game! GO SHARKS! xoxo!
author: Crystal V.

description: This place was great. We were staying two blocks away and wanted good, quick pizza. The calamari was huge, the pizza was delicious, and the staff was really friendly. We fed two adults and three kids for about $50, compared to $250 at the other restaurants close by. It's not fancy, but the pizza was delicious.
author: John S.

description: Wow, I'm surprised there are such low reviews on this place. Gotta boost up the ratings here a little. The pizzas here tastes great. You must eat it fresh right when they bring it out the oven and right after they cut it or else it will get soggy. The cheese is all melted and when you take a bite and pull the slice away, the cheese wll be stringy.  The crust taste great too. Sauce isn't too saucy. Fresh tasting ingredients. All in all, GREAT pizza. Service usually depends on who you get. Bathrooms are kinda far. I honestly think this place has the best pizza in S.F. I would give it a 5 star but its kinda pricey for pizza, service is alright but sometimes slow and not too friendly.
author: Vinh T.

description: It might not be fair to give a poor review for something best known for pizza and not ordering pizza. I ordered the meatball sandwich. It was difficult to eat. Meatballs were huge, but tasted bad. They tasted more like meatloaf than meatballs. The sauce was decent but a bit on the spicy side. I was also dissapointed when I saw there was no cheese! It came with chips, but it was the tiniest bag of chips I've ever seen. Overall very disapointed and should have ordered the pizza.
author: Sara L.

description: Decent pizza. Warm, welcome environment, however it is way overpriced and the service isn't outstanding. They charge you extra for everything under the sun including topping, refills, exc. It seems like all they care about is nickle and dimeing you rather than providing you with good customer service and outstanding pizza. So if you're worried about spending a lot, I advise you to not come here. I most likely will not be returning.
author: Kerry Z.

description: I know this is pizza we're talking about and you really can't go wrong with pizza, but I gotta say this place did! By far the worst pizza place I've been to of all time!!! The service, well lets just say they did the minimum they needed to do, I'll just leave it at that.  The place wasn't very clean looking at all, the only reason we stopped here cause we were starving and my kids had to have pizza.  Well the pizza was horrid, the crust was krispy, for the first 5 minutes, then completely soggy.  I'm pretty sure the pizza sauce was either powdered tomato with water or just a regular can of tomato sauce, because it had to flavor what so ever and it was literally watered down and that just killed it for me! I don't know how this place is still in business!!! Stay away from here!! Did I mention how way over priced this place is, save your money and go to Little Caesar's!!!
author: Phil A.

description:
FOOD, C-
-Pizza was nothing special.  We had onion rings and garlic bread too, as with the pizza, these were both nothing to write home about.
-They do have a couple of decent craft brews on draft.  Plus, for that.

SERVICE, D-
-Was actually shocked how bad the service was.  Both waitresses didn't seem to care about any customers, or what was going on.  Two tables hadn't been bussed before we got there, and by the time we left they still hadn't been bussed.

PRICE, D-
-$60 w/o tip for a large pie, two aps, and four beers.

OVERALL, D+
-Would I go here again? No.  
-Nothing at all stands out about this place.  Beer was served in plastic mugs, there is no bathroom in the restaurant (its outside, and down the block), the chairs sucked, the food wasn't too good, the waitstaff was terrible, and it was fairly expensive.
author: Blake T.

description: Me and my friends came here for a late dinner one night because we were toolazy to walk anywhere else (we were staying at the Marriott Courtyard on the same black). The pizza was kind of heavy and not very good but I didn't really have the highest expectations going into a place called the "Fisherman's Pizzeria" anyway. Service was kind of flighty which was bad cause we were the only people in there. Also the bill was pretty high, 1 small and 1 medium pizzas with a few toppings, 2 sodas and a beer set me back almost $50.
author: Sarah F.

description: For quite some time, I was convinced that a great crust and the right tomato sauce could carry any pizza, no matter how dismal the toppings. As it turns out, I was wrong :( I ordered a pepperoni & ground beef pizza at Fisherman's and it was strangely tasteless. My friend and I concluded that the problem was likely the cheap, unsalted mozzarella.  It's too bad.. with the super friendly staff, great crust/tomato sauce and in-house espresso machine, this could have been a neighborhood favorite.
author: Chrissy Q.

description: Today we drove an hour to stop here to eat pizza on the way to a museum.  We asked for a quarter of it to be pepperoni for our son and they said sure.  The pizza was under cooked and most of it was pepperoni on it. The server asked if it was okay and said they could remake it which we agreed to that. The server talked to the cook who was watching football at the time since we were the only people in there at noon.  He argued with the server  loudly about how he wasn't going to do it.  We decided to leave and pay for drinks.  We make a remark about why we were leaving and the cook just arged and when I made a comment the gentleman rudely told me that he was talking to my husband and he wouldn't look at me and from his comment and his mannerism it was telling he wouldn't because I was a female.  Never been so insulted by a anyone.  He didn't care and funny thing is they didn't care that they were empty at noon on a busy weekend.   We have loved this place in the past but I will not go back of this guy is working but looking at the reviews I don't think they care.  Best advice go across the street to the pizza by slice.  Very good service
author: Stephanie W.

description: Not even worth a star....worst place ever! We were hoping to get slices and turns out they don't serve them. So, we ordered a small cheese for the kids, and a meatball sandwich for me and my husband to split. OMG! The meatball sandwich was open faced..no cheese..and omg the GARLIC!! I almost threw up!! My husband and I kept trying to eat it only because we were STARVING! Wish we hadn't....made us so sick for the next 2 days! Throwing up....both ends...ick!! While we were there, we had asked for refills on our soda ($2.50 each for a sm/med size cup). I stood up at the front for at least 5 minutes while being overlooked on purpose. Then one of the ladies took my cups from me..and then came back and said "our menu states its $1 extra for refills" Um..I just paid $10 for 4 drinks....and you're going to charge me another $1 each for refills??? I walked away with my drinks pissed off....like ARE YOU KIDDING? the lady came and took my drinks back from me!!! Didn't even give me a chance to try to pay for them....I ran up to her and said FUCKIN WORST SERVICE EVER!!!!!!!!!!!! LOL! I was so livid!! Never again..in fact I'm trying to get my money back for the whole deal. They won't answer the phone though, so I have to call my bank and deal with this. DO NOT GO THERE!! RIP OFF!!!
author: chelsea e.

description: Good pizza place to hang out at if you happen to be in the Marina District.  It's got pretty good prices with a decent pizza.
author: Sean W.

description: I have NEVER EVER not given a tip before... This was my first time.  This was the worst waitress ever.  And dirtiest place. She never smiled, never checked on us and when we asked for some water, it had a small fly in it and was extremely foggy.  The waitress was eating behind the counter and licking her fingers and then she and the cook were touching money and then not washing their hands.  The trash was overflowing and food all over the floor and they were all playfully arguing over who was going to have to dump it.  The pizza was so greasy we had to blot it like 10 times in order to eat it.  When we asked for a to-go box, she brought a clear plastic container that looked like it had spit in it.  The 2 waitresses and the cook were laughing and joking around and never once even after I raised my hand finally for service did they even acknowledge us.  It was unbelievable.  And to top it off our table wobbled the entire time like it was off balance and our drinks kept spilling.  So we had to hold the table in a certain spot the whole time.  We couldn't wait to get out of there.  Steer clear!
author: Meesh D.

description: What a dump.  Health services should shut these people down.  After we ordered, we noticed the cooks just chucking garbage near the can on the floor.  The tables and floor were covered with trash and food remnants.  We were charged a fortune for a 12" pizza that sat there getting cold while we waited for the staff to figure out it was sitting there.  When we complained about it being cold, no one really spoke English - so good luck with that.  Overall, a dirty place with bad food, rude/bad service.  DON'T eat there.
author: Lisa H.

description: Well, I guess I should preface with the fact that I'm 32 years old, have traveled stateside and abroad multiple times and have never in my "relatively" short life ever ever - seen a rodent scurrying past my feet in ANY sort of food related establishment...um, up until tonight that is! That being said, I can't actually rate this particular establishment in regards to it's food per se as I spent roughly 8 minutes inside before leaving nauseous...I was only 2 sips into my chardonnay when our disgusting lil Ratatouille made his guest appearance...barreling down the the edge of the wall which unfortunately was the same edge of the wall our booth was backed up against...after my husband alerted me to the situation by calmly screaming we proceeded to explain our hasty departure to the waitress who shrugged her shoulders with indifference and poorly pretended to look just a teeny tiny bit surprised...hmmm...if I could give this negative stars I would...in one word - FILTHY!!!
author: Ashley E.
